abstract_summ: ESR can be used as a valuable indicator for distinguishing severe COVID-19 patients in early stage, so as to increase the survival of severe patients.According to scoring system, the probability of patients in high risk group developing severe disease was 20.24 times than that in low risk group.Results: A total of 43 COVID-19 patients were included in this study, including 29 mild patients and 14 sever patients.Although 10–20% of patients with COVID-19 have severe symptoms, little is known about the risk factors related to the aggravation of COVID-19 symptoms from asymptomatic or mild to severe disease states.Methods: In this study, 43 COVID-19 patients admitted in Chongqing Public Health Medical Center were involved.
title_summ: Potential Factors for Prediction of Disease Severity of COVID-19 PatientsA cohort study of 223 patients explores the clinical risk factors for the severity diagnosis of COVID-19Development and Validation of a Diagnostic Nomogram to Predict COVID-19 PneumoniaAssociation of SARS-CoV-2 Genomic Load with COVID-19 Patient OutcomesLymphopenia predicts disease severity of COVID-19: a descriptive and predictive studyPredictive factors of severe coronavirus disease 2019 in previously healthy young adults: a single-center, retrospective studyIndividualized prediction nomograms for disease progression in mild COVID‐19The characteristics and outcomes of 681 severe cases with COVID-19 in ChinaRadiomics nomogram for the prediction of 2019 novel coronavirus pneumonia caused by SARS-CoV-2A Novel Scoring System for Prediction of Disease Severity in COVID-19Development and validation of the HNC-LL score for predicting the severity of coronavirus disease 2019Risk factors for disease progression in COVID-19 patientsIdentification and validation of a novel clinical signature to predict the prognosis in confirmed COVID-19 patientsA novel simple scoring model for predicting severity of patients with SARS‐CoV‐2 infectionA simple algorithm helps early identification of SARS-CoV-2 infection patients with severe progression tendencyScoring systems for predicting mortality for severe patients with COVID-19Novel coronavirus disease 2019: predicting prognosis by using a computed tomography severity score and clinicolaboratory data.
title_abstract_phrases: ESR can be used as a valuable indicator for distinguishing severe COVID-19 patients in early stage, so as to increase the survival of severe patients.Development and Validation of a Diagnostic Nomogram to Predict COVID-19 PneumoniaBackground: The COVID-19 virus is an emerging virus rapidly spread worldwide This study aimed to establish an effective diagnostic nomogram for suspected COVID-19 pneumonia patients.Results: A total of 43 COVID-19 patients were included in this study, including 29 mild patients and 14 sever patients.According to scoring system, the probability of patients in high risk group developing severe disease was 20.24 times than that in low risk group.Although 10–20% of patients with COVID-19 have severe symptoms, little is known about the risk factors related to the aggravation of COVID-19 symptoms from asymptomatic or mild to severe disease states.
